intro: Pistolochia buschii, commonly known as the Florida pistolpod, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant produces distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in late spring and early summer. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, bean-like seeds. The plant is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites.
